lead_paragraph: Natasha Hastings and Shalonda Solomon, both three-time N.C.A.A. champions at South Carolina, will give up their senior seasons of eligibility to turn professional. Hastings, from New York, emerged this year as one of the country’s top 400-meter runners. She broke the collegiate record with a time of 49.84 seconds at last week’s United States track and field championships, when she finished second to DeeDee Trotter and earned a spot on the United States team for the world championships. Solomon, from Inglewood, Calif., won the indoor and outdoor N.C.A.A. 200-meter crowns in 2006, and shared a title with the 1,600-meter relay indoor team her freshman year in 2005.
